Popup.Title: Scan Completed
Popup.OneHigh: The privacy and security scan has been completed. You have 1 high risk issue. Open the reporting page to see more information.
Popup.MultipleHigh: The privacy and security scan has been completed. You have %d high risk issues. Open the reporting page to see more information.
Popup.OneMedium: The privacy and security scan has been completed. You have 1 medium risk issue. Open the reporting page to see more information.
Popup.MultipleMedium: The privacy and security scan has been completed. You have %d medium risk issues. Open the reporting page to see more information.
Popup.Default: The privacy and security scan has been completed. Open the reporting page to view the results.
Popup.Startup: InfoSec Agent has started and is running in the background. Open the system tray to access the application.
Popup.AlreadyRunning: InfoSec Agent is already running in the background. Open the system tray to access the application.

Dashboard.BarGraphDescription: This graph shows the distribution of issues of different risk levels found over the past scans.
Dashboard.ShareText: Select where to share your progress, save and download it, then share it with others!
Dashboard.TooltipText: The more active you are in resolving issues, the more you are working towards becoming more secure! This is displayed by the building of your lighthouse. At the beginning there won't be much, but staying consistent in the use of InfoSec Agent will let you build a beautiful lighthouse. To transition to the next lighthouse state, the progress bar needs to be full.
Dashboard.ProgressTextAlmost: Keep using the app and you will achieve a higher tier!

Issues.Permissions: The following applications currently have been given permission:

About.AboutInfo: The InfoSec Agent is a security and privacy tool for Windows 10 and 11.
About.SummaryInfo: The InfoSec Agent project aims to improve the security and privacy of Windows computer users. Currently, there are applications available that do this, but they are mainly targeted at large companies. The goal of this project is to make this accessible to everyone. An application is being developed that collects information about the user's system to discover any security or privacy-related vulnerabilities. The results will be presented to the user in a special dashboard, showing the current status of the system, including recommended actions to improve it.
About.AffiliationsInfo: This project is a collaborative effort involving nine students from Utrecht University in The Netherlands, in partnership with the Dutch IT company Guardian360. It serves as the Software Project for the Bachelor's Programme in Computing Sciences at the UU. This project is also supported by funding from the SIDN Fund (Stichting Internet Domeinregistratie Nederland), the Dutch domain name registrar.
About.ContributingInfo: InfoSec-Agent is an Open-Source project licensed under the AGPL-3.0 Licence. However, due to its origins as a Utrecht University assignment, public contributions to this repository will only be merged after the completion of this assignment, which is scheduled for 24th June 2024. Feel free to report any bugs or issues you encounter. Your feedback is valuable and helps improve the InfoSec-Agent project. You can email us at infosecagentuu@gmail.com

Integration.ApiKeyDescription: Coming soon: this functionality is not available yet, you will be able to connect to the Lighthouse API in the near future.
Integration.Step1: Login to your account on https://lighthouse.guardian360.nl and go to the settings
Integration.Step2: Go to the API section and create a new token
Integration.Step3: Copy the token and paste it in the field below, you can then click on the 'connect' button

AllChecks.MultipleLines: Here are some checks we run regarding your
AllChecks.SingleLine: Here is a check we run regarding your
AllChecks.ApplicationsText: Applications are computer software made for users with a certain functionality. Most applications are not malicious when installed from the right place, but as a user you have to be aware of what you are downloading and using.
AllChecks.DevicesText: Your computer is a device, but it can also be connected to other devices. These devices are mostly tools like a mouse, keyboard and headset. But because these devices are connected directly to your computer, they have a lot of access to it. To make sure no malicious devices, used to steal data or comprimise the security of you computer, you need to check whether you know the devices connected to your PC.
AllChecks.NetworkText: Most of your data will be stored on your computer, but some data will be transferred across networks. Malicious users can intercept your data if it is not transferred in a secure manner.
AllChecks.OSText: The Operating System is the backbone of computers. It therefore plays an integral part in keeping your computer secure. When setting up your OS, it already enables and disables some features to keep your computer secure, but not all settings are preferable.
AllChecks.PasswordsText: Passwords are keys which prevent malicious users from having access to your computer or accounts. Having a password is almost always required when creating an account somewhere, but having a password does not always mean it is secure enough. Easy passwords can be guessed, but hard ones may be hard to remember.
AllChecks.OtherSecurityText: Keeping your computer secure can also be done in some other ways.
AllChecks.PermissionsText: Applications installed on your computer want to have access to or permission to use certain features or devices connected to your PC. It is your responsibility as a user to give those permissions to certain applications or not. It is therefore recommended to search on the internet if an application you use should or should not have certain permissions.
AllChecks.BrowserText: To have access to the internet, you use a browser. While a browser is really useful, it is not always keeping your data private. To stay safe while browsing on the internet, you have to always keep in mind what you are clicking on.
AllChecks.OtherPrivacyText: Keeping your data private can also be done in some other ways.
AllChecks.BrowserZeroFound: These checks could not be done, since the browser is probably not installed.
